DOC.brief_summary: The study null hypothethesis is: intrauterine insemination (IUI) does not improve pregnancy rates in women with polycystic ovary syndrome. Infertile women with pcos will receive gonadotropins for ovarian stimulation and then randomize to either IUI or timed intercourse (TI)
DOC.brief_title: Ovarian Stimulation and Intrauterine Insemination in Women With Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome
DOC.criteria: women who failed to get pregnant after 6 ovulation induction cycles with clomiphene citrate (cc) alone, despite of being ovulating with cc, having patent Fallopian tubes as confirmed by hysterosalpingography and their partners had fertile semen parameters according to criteria of World Health Organization (WHO 2010) male factor infertility
